faqs.question: How do I mark a passage as read?
faqs.answer: Tap the book icon next to each passage to mark it as read. You can also long-press on a day card to mark all passages for that day as complete.

faqs.question: How can I listen to the readings?
faqs.answer: Go to Settings, scroll down to the **Reading Preferences** section and enable the **Prefer YouVersion** option (make sure you have [YouVersion](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/bible/id282935706) installed on your device.) This will open the passages in YouVersion instead of the app, allowing you to listen to the readings.

faqs.question: Can I sync my progress across devices?
faqs.answer: Yes! With a premium subscription, your reading progress automatically syncs across all your devices using iCloud.

faqs.question: How do I change my reading plan?
faqs.answer: Tap on the plan name at the top of the Read tab to select a different reading schedule. You can choose from M’Cheyne, Old & New Testament Daily, and other plans.

faqs.question: What if I fall behind in my reading?
faqs.answer: Don’t worry! If you fall behind, the app will show you how many days you’re behind and offer to adjust your start date to get you back on track.

faqs.question: How do I change my start date?
faqs.answer: Go to Settings and tap on ‘Start Date’ to select when you want your reading year to begin. Your schedule will automatically adjust.

faqs.question: Can I take notes on passages?
faqs.answer: Yes! With a premium subscription, you can tap the notes icon when reading a passage to add your thoughts and reflections. Your notes are automatically synced across all your devices with iCloud.

faqs.question: Someone I know would like to use one of these schedules, but they don’t own an iPhone or iPad. How can they use this?
faqs.answer: For the Old & New schedule, they can obtain a physical copy of this schedule [here](https://www.crossway.org/tracts/through-the-bible-in-a-year-2656/) or a digital free CSV version [here](https://yearly-bible-schedule.csv). The M’Cheyne schedule is available as a free PDF [here](https://www.mcheyne.info/calendar.pdf) and the Genre schedule is available as a free PDF [here](https://faithconnector.s3.amazonaws.com/10660/files/bible_reading_plans/genre_bible-plan.pdf).
